title: Drawing, before 1750
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor over black chalk on white laid paper
provenance: From the Collection of Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: An elaborate four wheeled open carriage designed in the Rococo style is shown in side view facing left. The seat, adorned with small portrait busts and rocaille is topped by a  small parasol.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, before 1750.
before 1750. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor over black chalk on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3188.
